title: How to Buy for a Vegan

steps.headline: Select the right food gift, avoiding any food made of meat or any other food that is a by-product of an animal.
steps.description: That includes milk, eggs, cheese, and in some cases, honey. Be sure gifts such as chocolate or pastry haven't been made using milk or eggs. Cakes and breads are included in this category as they are typically made with one or both of these products.

steps.headline: Get a kitchen aid such as a food dehydrator, which will dehydrate and preserve fruits and vegetables.
steps.description: A soy milk maker is another appliance you might choose.

steps.headline: Present a potted herb garden which can be placed in a sunny window by the recipient.
steps.description: Herbs can be picked fresh and used in cooking and also add fragrance to the home.

steps.headline: Consider getting your vegan friend or family member a vegetarian or vegan cookbook.
steps.description: There are many cookbooks to choose from all giving recipes and tips for vegetarian cooking. For example, if the person for whom you are buying the cookbook does not use animal by-products, be sure the recipes exclude using eggs or butter.

steps.headline: Check any beauty product to be sure that the manufacturer does not test their products on animals.
steps.description: This applies to lotions, perfumes, and all cosmetic items. Some products will indicate that fact on the label. Be sure a hair or make-up brush hasn't been made from animal hair.

steps.headline: Choose the right piece of clothing or accessory to give as a vegan gift.
steps.description: Avoid anything made of leather. Non-vegans may forget that the wallet or handbag they are buying has been made from the skin of an animal. Belts, jackets, headbands, or even jewelry that has been strung on a piece of leather are not acceptable for a vegan. True vegans will not accept products made of wool or silk. Be sure to stop and consider whether the object has been derived from an animal including insects. Be certain the scarf or necktie you choose is made of cotton or another plant or synthetic material. Of course, anything made of real fur should be avoided. Jewelry and other clothing items made from shells might also not make an appropriate gift to give to a vegan.

steps.headline: Purchase candles made from soy.
steps.description: Many candles are derived from beeswax or stearic acid, which are animal by-products. Soy candles are environmentally friendly, unlike paraffin wax which is made from petroleum.

steps.headline: Buy your vegan loved one a gift card to a favorite vegetarian restaurant or food shop.
Make a gift donation in their name to an animal rescue group or animal rights organization.
steps.description: The vegan for whom you are buying a gift will appreciate your respect for their commitment to animal welfare.

steps.headline: Find a vegetarian or vegan specialty store from which to buy your gift.
steps.description: You will be able to find books, clothing, foods and other items here which are especially geared for vegans.

steps.headline: A bottle of wine or a gourmet quality olive oil would also make a special gift for a vegan.
steps.description: Many vegetarian cooks think olive oil adds flavor to sauteed or grilled vegetables. Olive oil is also a healthy addition to your diet as it is heart-healthy.

steps.headline: Buy them an experience.
steps.description: Get them tickets to the movies, a museum that involves their interests, indoor skydiving, a trampoline park, or anywhere else they would enjoy going to. If you're looking for a really big gift, you could get them vacation tickets to somewhere they've always wanted to go. Some vegans do not support circuses or zoos. Avoid buying tickets to these. Remember, sometimes a good experience can spark more enjoyment than a material gift!
